properties.headline: Musical opening night - Thursday 10 June - HAYMARKET Pitt St and Campbell St at Capitol Theatre
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Come From Away opening night special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Come From Away opening night special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Approximately 1,500 people are expected to attend the opening night of Come From Away at Capitol Theatre on Thursday 10 June from 5pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

From 4am until midnight on Thursday 10 June the westbound lanes on Campbell St between Pitt St and George St will be closed. Campbell St will become 2-way during the closure. The parking lane on Pitt St between Hay St and Campbell St will also be closed. 

The footpath on the southern side of Campbell St between Pitt St and George St will be closed from 5pm until midnight. 

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 4am until midnight on Thursday on Campbell Street between Pitt Street and George Street (northern side), Campbell Street between Pitt Street and the Capitol Theatre box office doors (southern side), and Pitt Street between Hay Street and Campbell Street (western side). 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK Figtree Drive at Australia Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NSW Health Vaccination Centre – transport and parking map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NSW Health Vaccination Centre – transport and parking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre is in operation on Monday to Saturdays from 8am to 8pm for those with confirmed appointments only. 

The nearest available parking is at P3 Car park on Sarah Durack Ave. Follow signage to walk to the centre, or catch the shuttle bus.

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct including Australia Ave, Underwood Rd and Hill Rd, particularly during the morning and evening peak periods.

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW Interactive Road Closure & Clearway Map

properties.headline: SMH Half Marathon - Sunday 27 June - SYDNEY CBD, THE ROCKS, BARANGAROO & PYRMONT Macquarie St, Cahill Expressway Overpass, Western Distributor, Pirrama Rd
properties.publicTransport: Buses and light rail services will diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads will close from 3.30am on Sunday morning while more than 10,000 participants take on the annual Half Marathon travelling from Hyde Park to Pyrmont and return via the Harbour Foreshore, Western Distributor and Cahill Expressway Overpass.

The Sydney Harbour Bridge remains open throughout the event however motorists should consider using the Sydney Harbour Tunnel to avoid traffic delays on detour routes in the CBD. There will be no direct access between the Western Distributor and Sydney Harbour Bridge in either direction. Access to the Anzac Bridge from the city is via the Druitt St on-ramp. Access to the Harbour Bridge from the city is via Kent St and Clarence St. 

KEY ROAD CLOSURES:

  • Hyde Park from 2am to 1pm: Park St between College St and Elizabeth St (event finish line).
  • Macquarie St from 3.30am to 11.30am: Macquarie St between St James Rd and Hunter St (event start line). Shakespeare Pl / Bent St will be a Macquarie St crossover until 6am and after 10:45am.
  • Circular Quay & The Rocks from 4.30am to 9am: roads north of Bent St including Bridge St, Alfred St, Pitt St, Young St, Loftus St, Macquarie St and George St / Hickson Rd north of Grosvenor St. Motorists travelling southbound on York St can access the Eastern Distributor via Liverpool and William Streets.
  • Western Distributor from 4am to 11am: the Western Distributor from Pyrmont to the CBD including Fig St, Pyrmont St and Market St on-ramps and King St and Harris St off-ramps will be closed. Motorists travelling citybound on the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via the Bathurst St off-ramp. Access to the Anzac Bridge from the CBD is via the Druitt St on-ramp or from Sydney Harbour Bridge and Harbour St.
  • Cahill Expressway from 4am to 11.30am: The Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass will be closed. Motorists travelling southbound to the Eastern Suburbs can use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel or travel through the CBD to access the Eastern Distributor via York St, King St, Elizabeth St, Liverpool St and William St.
  • Pyrmont & Ultimo from 4.30am and 11am: Pirrama Rd, Bowman St, Union St, Murray St, Darling Drive and surrounding local roads. Motorists travelling to the city or the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be diverted via Harris St and local roads in Ultimo and Haymarket.
  • Millers Point & Barangaroo from 4.30am to 11am: Sussex St, Hickson Rd, Kent St, Pottinger St, Windmill St and Watson Rd. Access to the Rocks is maintained via York St, Lang St and Harrington St.
  • Sydney CBD from 4.30am to 11.30am: sections of Macquarie St, Bridge St, Bent St, College St, Hunter St and St James Rd. Access the Eastern Distributor via Liverpool and William Streets.
  • The Domain from 4.30am to 12pm: Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect between 1.30am and 12:30pm on various roads throughout the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

Access to CBD North via Kent Sydney Harbour Bridge southbound traffic to the Western Distributor will be diverted to Harbour St: Access to Western Distributor – left Bathurst St, left Kent St, left Druitt St Access to Pyrmont and Ultimo – right Pier St

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
KING ST WHARF, COCKLE BAY WHARF & BARANGAROO

While Hickson Rd is closed access to King St Wharf, Barangaroo South and Crown Sydney will be restricted to tenants/residents only and managed under traffic control. We strongly advise motorists to avoid non-essential travel to or from these precincts between 5am and 10am as delays are expected.

  • Before 6am and after 10am: access via Erskine St
  • From 5.30am to 10am: entry to the precinct will be managed at the northern end of Wheat Rd between the Western Distributor and King St (access from Harbour St). Exit will be managed via Wheat Rd under two-way traffic control, only for vehicles 7m and under (21 seat minibuses and smaller)

Vehicles over 7metres will be unable to use the managed exit and will need to remain within the precinct until Erskine St reopens. Before 6am and after 10am entry and exit is maintained via Erskine St at Kent St.

THE ROCKS / MILLERS POINT

From 9am to 11am, local access will be managed under traffic control at the Kent St and Erskine St intersection for access to properties on Kent St as far north as High St. Managed access from High St to Dalgety Rd, Bettington St, and Barangaroo Car Park

Prior to 9am there will be no managed vehicle access to this area due to the runners on course. Access to and from The Rocks & Dawes Point is maintained throughout the event via Lang St and Harrington St.

Vehicles are not permitted to exit a driveway or carpark onto a closed road. If you require access to your vehicle during the event you will need to relocate it outside the closure footprint prior to the road closures. Once roads are closed no vehicle movements will be permitted until the roads have safely reopened.

CIRCULAR QUAY

Circular Quay Roads closed between 4:30am and 9:00am, traffic control will manage vehicles exiting from properties at the times and locations below.

  • From 4:30am to 6:00am: exit only via Phillip St southbound and exit only via Pitt St
  • From 6:00am to 8:30am: no exit
  • From 8:30am to 9:00am: exit via Phillip St southbound if safe to allow

SYDNEY CBD

Sydney Hospital/Hospital Road

Between 4:30am and 11:30am access to Hospital Rd and Sydney Hospital is via Shakespeare Pl under two-way traffic control

PYRMONT

Access into Pyrmont will be available via Pier Street and Harris Street or via the Pyrmont Bridge Road (Fish Market) off-ramp and Allen Street off-ramp from the Western Distributor. We strongly advise to delay any non-essential travel through the area until roads have reopened

  • Pyrmont St south of Quarry St between 4am and 11am: access via Harris St southbound then left Quarry St, right Pyrmont St. Exit the same way under two-way traffic control.
  • Residential access to Gipps St and Experiment St between 4am and 11am: access via Harris St southbound then left into Allen St

Murray St between Union St and Pyrmont St

  • between 4:30am and 11am: enter via Darling Dr
  • between 4:30am and 9:15am: exit via Darling Dr

Pyrmont St residential car park driveways between Bunn Ln and Allen St: no access between 6am and 9:15am
arrangementElements.title: Local access arrangements

arrangementElements.html:
CYCLEWAY CLOSURES

SYDNEY CBD - From 4:30AM to 9:00AM

  • Pitt St between Alfred St and Bridge St    

SYDNEY CBD / PYRMONT - From 4:30AM to 11:00AM

  • King St between Kent St and Sussex St  
  • Union St between Edward St and Murray St    

CYCLIST DETOURS

From 6:45AM to 10:15AM  

Cycling detours will be in place between Kent St cycleway and Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway, via Observatory Hill. Marshals will direct cyclists across Upper Fort St in both directions when safe gaps between runners present. Alternatively, cyclists can travel between Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway and Sydney CBD via Cumberland St.

  • To Sydney Harbour Bridge from Kent Street cycleway - turn right Kent St on ramp shared path,  cycling/pedestrian bridge to Upper Fort St, left Sydney Observatory access road, right Observatory Hill shared path, proceed to Upper Fort St managed bicycle crossing and marshal
  • To Kent Street from Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway - proceed to Upper Fort St managed bicycle crossing and marshal, proceed via Observatory Hill shared path, turn left onto Sydney Observatory access road, right to the cycling/pedestrian bridge and Kent St on ramp shared path, proceed to Kent Street cycleway
arrangementElements.title: Cycleway closures and detours

properties.headline: AFL - Friday 11 June - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map Mar21SCO_1080.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Hawkthorn Hawks at the SCG. Gates open 6pm, first bounce 7:50pm, finish around 10pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and around Moore Park as thousands of fans travel to the stadium during the busy Friday evening peak. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the game and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm until midnight on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

properties.headline: Concert -  Friday 11 June - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Chatham Road
properties.otherAdvice:
Amy Shark live at Newcastle Entertainment Centre, Broadmeadow. Doors open 6:30pm. Finish approx 11pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the Entertainment Centre.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Cycling event - Sunday 30 May to Tuesday 1 June - WOLLONGONG TO NORWEST VIA HUSKISSON, KIAMA AND BOWRAL Princes Highway, Bolong Road, Old Hume Highway and Old Windsor Road
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 100 cyclists will take part in the three-day Tour De Cure cycling event travelling from Wollongong to Norwest via Huskisson, Bowral and Kiama from 8am on Sunday 30 May, finishing by 4:30pm on Tuesday 1 June. 

  • On Sunday 30 May: cyclists will travel from Wollongong to Huskisson via Kiama and Nowra along Woollamia Rd, Princes Hwy and Bolong Rd.
  • On Monday 31 May: cyclists will travel from Huskisson to Bowral via Kangaroo Valley along Island Point Road, Princes Hwy, Turpentine Rd and Bryces Rd.
  • On Tuesday 1 June: cyclists will travel from Bowral to Norwest via Luddenham along Old Hume Hwy, The Northern Rd, Sunnyholt Rd and Old Windsor Rd.

Motorists should be aware of cyclists using the Princes Hwy and to exercise caution and remember when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.
properties.displayName: Cycling event - Sunday 30 May to Tuesday 1 June

roads.mainStreet: Princes Highway, Bolong Road, Old Hume Highway and Old Windsor Road
roads.suburb: Wollongong to Norwest via Huskisson, Kiama and Bowral

properties.headline: Reconciliation Walk - Tuesday 1 June - QUEANBEYAN Monaro Street between Lowe Street AND Atkinson Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,000 people will take part in a walk for National Reconciliation Week from 10:15am to 12pm midday on Tuesday 1 June.

The group will travel from Ray Morton Park to Queanbeyan Park via Queens Bridge and Monaro St. 

Monaro St between Lowe St and Atkinson St will be closed while the walk is underway between 10.15am and 12pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and follow the detours via local roads.

properties.headline: A-League - Tuesday 1 June - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Newcastle Jets at Central Coast Stadium, Gosford, from 7:05pm to approx 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game during Tuesday evening peak. 

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the game from 5pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - Thursday 3 June - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Broncos at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick off from 7:50pm, full-time around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium during Thursday evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium will close before the game including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: NRL - Friday 4 June - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Panthers from 7:55pm until 9:55pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event during Friday evening peak.

Mary St will be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: A-League - Friday 4 June - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Macarthur FC v Wellington Phoenix at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick off from 7:05pm, full-time around 9pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to the stadium during Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: NRL - Sunday 30 May - COFFS HARBOUR Pacific Highway and Stadium Drive approaching C.ex Coffs International Stadium
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Titans at C.ex Coffs International Stadium, Coffs Harbour from 2pm to approx 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Pacfic Hwy at Stadium Dr as footy fans travel to and from the game at Coffs International Stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area.

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 30 May - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Brisbane Roar at Bankwest Stadium from 4:05pm until 6pm approx.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL -  Sunday 30 May - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Sea Eagles at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick off from 4:05pm, full-time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: AFL - Sunday 30 May - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Hill Road approaching GIANTS Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Richmond v Adelaide at GIANTS Stadium from 2:10pm until approx 5pm. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Silverwater Rd, Hill Rd, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as fans travel to the game on Sunday afternoon. 

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Hill Road

properties.headline: Rugby Union - Sunday 30 May - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Trans-Tasman Rugby: Highlanders v Rebels at Leichhardt Oval from 3pm until 5pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: AFL - Saturday 29 May - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Gold Coast v Hawthorn at the SCG. First bounce from 7:40pm, finish around 10:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park as  fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

properties.headline: Concert - Saturday 29 May - MUDGEE Nicholson Street and Douro Street approaching Mudgee Showground
properties.otherAdvice:
The Next Exit concert at Mudgee Showground. Gates open from 3pm, concert finish at 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the showground as fans travel to and from the concert.

Motorists travelling in the area should be aware of increased vehicle and pedestrian activity and allow extra travel time.

properties.headline: Special events - Saturday 29 May - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Hill Road approaching Stadium Australia
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Various events are taking place at Sydney Olympic Park on Saturday 29 May with large crowds expected in the precinct:

  • Music festival: at Sydney Showground from 5pm to 10pm
  • NRL: Rabbitohs v Eels at Stadium Australia from 5:30pm to 7:30pm
  • NBL: Sydney Kings v Melbourne United at Qudos Bank Arena from 7:45pm until 10pm

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Silverwater Rd, Hill Rd, Homebush Bay Dr, Centenary Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as fans travel to the events. 

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Hill Road

properties.headline: NRL - Saturday 29 May - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Raiders at Central Coast Stadium, Gosford. Kick off at 7:30pm, full-time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to the game during Friday evening peak. 

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the game from 3:30pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Police Operation - Sunday 30 May - SYDNEY CBD Macquarie St
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays. Check transportnsw.info service alerts for details.
properties.adviceB: Expect delays; Use an alternative route
properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling road closures will be in place until approx 1pm on the northbound lanes of Macquarie St between St James Rd and Tarpeian Way at Royal Botanic Garden for a Police Operation. Roads will progressively re-open when safe to do so.

Motorists should consider an alternative route, allow extra travel time and follow directions of NSW Police on site.

properties.headline: Police Operation - Sunday 30 May - SYDNEY CBD Bathurst Street, Elizabeth Street and Hay Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays and light rail services will be impacted. Check transportnsw.info service alerts for details.
properties.adviceB: Expect delays; Use an alternative route
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place from 2pm until approx 3pm on sections of Bathurst St, Elizabeth St and Hay St for a Police Operation. Roads will progressively re-open when safe to do so.

Motorists should consider an alternative route, allow extra travel time and follow directions of NSW Police on site.

Western Distributor citybound motorists should access Sydney CBD via King St instead of Bathurst St while closures are in place to avoid delays.

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY CBD

Between 1:45PM and 3:00PM

  • Bathurst St1 between Kent St and George St  
  • Bathurst St between George St and Elizabeth St  
  • Campbell St between Castlereagh St and Elizabeth St  
  • Castlereagh St between Park St and Bathurst St  
  • Clarke St between Nithsdale St and Elizabeth St westbound
  • Elizabeth St between Park St and Wentworth Ave southbound
  • Elizabeth St between Albion St and Goulburn St northbound
  • Foy Ln between Goulburn St and Elizabeth St  
  • Goulburn St between Wentworth Ave and Elizabeth St westbound
  • Hay St between Pitt St and Elizabeth St eastbound
  • Hay St between Elizabeth St and Castlereagh St westbound
  • Liverpool St between College St and Elizabeth St westbound
  • Nithsdale Ln between Nithsdale St and Elizabeth St  
  • Pitt St between Liverpool St and Bathurst St  

Notes

 1 Bathurst St may close between Kent St and George St earlier if patronage exceeds capacity at the Town Hall assembly location.

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Carlton Blues at the SCG. Gates open at 1.30pm, first bounce from 3.20pm, finish around 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park as thousands of fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12.30pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm to 7pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

FROM 1PM TO 7PM - SUNDAY 30 MAY

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
